reasons_to_visit.details: August is the warmest month (17-25°C) with perfect conditions for exploring the historic center and outdoor activities.
The second largest rose garden in Czech Republic (4,500 rose bushes) is in full bloom, creating spectacular photo opportunities.
Perfect weather for enjoying traditional Czech cuisine on restaurant terraces and in beer gardens throughout the city.
Various summer cultural events, open-air concerts, and performances in historic venues like St. Maurice Church.
Extended daylight allows for comprehensive sightseeing including evening walks around the UNESCO World Heritage Holy Trinity Column.

reasons_to_avoid.details: August shares July's crowd levels with very busy attractions, especially around the Holy Trinity Column and Upper Square.
Can be uncomfortably hot during midday, especially when exploring the historic center's cobblestone streets.
Continued peak season pricing for all services and accommodations, with higher rates than shoulder seasons.
Many Czech families take summer holidays, and some traditional restaurants may close as locals travel.
